title: Creamy Beef Shells Casserole
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Add diced onion and minced garlic, cooking until the onion is translucent.
Add ground beef to the skillet, cooking until browned.
Drain any excess fat.
Stir in beef broth, heavy cream, diced tomatoes, dried basil, and dried oregano.
Bring the mixture to a simmer.
Add shell pasta to the skillet, stirring to combine.
Cover and cook for 15-20 minutes, or until the pasta is cooked through and the sauce has thickened.
Stir in shredded cheddar cheese until melted and well incorporated.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Garnish with fresh parsley if desired and serve warm.

title: Caprese Stuffed Garlic Butter Portobellos
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
Clean the portobello mushrooms and remove the stems. Place them on a baking sheet, gill side up.
In a small bowl, mix the melted butter with minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Brush this mixture over the mushrooms.
In a separate bowl, combine the cherry tomatoes, mozzarella balls, and basil. Season with salt and pepper.
Spoon the tomato and mozzarella mixture into each portobello cap, distributing evenly.
Bake in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, or until the mushrooms are tender and the cheese is melted.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving, if desired.

title: Creamy Parmesan Italian Sausage Ditalini Soup
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the Italian sausage and cook until browned and crumbled, about 5-7 minutes.
Add the chopped onion and garlic to the pot and cook for 3 more minutes until fragrant and softened.
Pour in the chicken broth and diced tomatoes, bringing the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes.
Stir in the ditalini pasta and cook for 8-10 minutes, or until the pasta is tender.
Stir in the heavy cream, Parmesan cheese, and Italian seasoning. Let it simmer for another 2-3 minutes, until the soup is creamy and well combined.
Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper to taste. Top with fresh parsley and serve hot.

title: Crockpot Steak Bites
ingredients: 2 lbs (900g) sirloin steak, cut into bite-sized cubes
2 tablespoons butter, cut into small pieces
instructions: Pat steak cubes dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture. This helps them sear better.
In a small bowl, whisk together soy sauce, beef broth, Worcestershire sauce, garlic, onion powder, smoked paprika, and black pepper.
Place the steak bites into the crockpot. Pour the marinade mixture over the steak, ensuring all pieces are well coated.
Dot the steak bites with butter pieces for extra richness.
Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or on high for 2-3 hours, until the steak bites are tender and cooked to your liking.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve warm. These steak bites are perfect over mashed potatoes, rice, or as an appetizer.

title: Creamy Sun Dried Tomato Shrimp with Spinach Pasta
ingredients: 8 oz fettuccine or pasta of choice
instructions: Cook the fettuccine according to package instructions; drain and set aside.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the shrimp to the skillet and cook for 3-4 minutes, or until they turn pink and opaque. Remove the shrimp and set aside.
In the same skillet, add the sun-dried tomatoes and spinach. Cook until the spinach is wilted.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in the Parmesan cheese until melted and smooth.
Add the cooked shrimp back to the skillet, along with the drained pasta. Toss to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve immediately, garnished with fresh basil.

title: Baked Chicken Ricotta Meatballs with Spinach
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, mix together ground chicken, ricotta, spinach, breadcrumbs, parmesan, egg, garlic, salt, pepper, and Italian seasoning until just combined.
Scoop and roll into 1½-inch meatballs and place on the baking sheet.
Bake for 20–25 minutes, or until golden and cooked through (internal temp of 165°F).
Optional: Broil for 2–3 minutes at the end for a golden top.
Serve with marinara, over pasta, or enjoy them as protein-packed bites!

title: Low Carb Taco Skillet with Cabbage
ingredients: 5 cups green cabbage, shredded or chopped
instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned. Drain any excess fat.
Stir in the shredded cabbage, taco seasoning, dry minced onion, and water. Cook while stirring occasionally until the cabbage is tender but still crisp.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese evenly over the skillet. Cover with a lid and let cook for 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is fully melted.
Remove from heat and serve immediately while warm.

title: One Pan Taco Zucchini Skillet
instructions: In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the ground beef until browned. Drain excess grease if needed.
Add the diced onion and garlic, cooking for 2-3 minutes until fragrant.
Stir in the diced zucchini and bell pepper, cooking for another 5 minutes until slightly tender.
Add the diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, salt, and black pepper. Stir well to combine.
Simmer for 5-7 minutes until the vegetables are fully cooked and flavors meld.
Sprinkle shredded cheddar cheese over the top, cover, and let it melt for about 2 minutes.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and sliced avocado if desired.

title: Chicken and Avocado Lettuce Wraps
instructions: Lay out the lettuce leaves on a plate.
In a bowl, mix the chicken, avocado, tomatoes, and bacon.
Squeeze in some lemon or lime juice, add salt and pepper, and mix well.
Spoon the mixture into each lettuce leaf.
Top with chopped herbs and serve cold.

title: Halloumi Tray Bake with Pesto Rice and Roasted Vegetables
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cut into 1-1.5 inch rounds
225g (8 oz) halloumi cheese, cut into 6 slices
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C / 390F. Oil a roasting dish and add sweet potatoes. Brush with oil and roast 20 mins.
Flip sweet potatoes. Add mushrooms, onion, pepper, and tomatoes. Drizzle with oil and balsamic.
Roast another 30 mins until veggies are charred and soft.
Heat rice and mix with pesto. Add to pan to fill spaces.
Add halloumi slices on top. Brush with oil.
Grill for 5 mins until halloumi is browned.
Serve with hummus.

title: Comforting Vegan Bourguignon
ingredients: 1 lb / 450g mixed mushrooms (cremini, shiitake, button), thickly sliced or quartered
Salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 lb / 450g potatoes (like Russet or Yukon Gold), peeled and cubed
1 medium head cauliflower, cut into florets (about 1 lb / 450g)
1/4 cup / 60ml unsweetened plant-based milk (almond, soy, oat)
2 tablespoons / 30ml olive oil or vegan butter
1-2 tablespoons / 5-10g nutritional yeast (optional, for cheesy flavor)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until browned and slightly crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Remove mushrooms and set aside.
Add onion, carrots, and celery to the pot. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes. Add minced garlic and cook for another minute until fragrant.
Sprinkle the flour over the vegetables and stir constantly for 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in the vegetable broth and water, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom. Bring to a simmer.
Stir in the tomato paste, soy sauce (or tamari), thyme, and bay leaf. Return the cooked mushrooms to the pot.
Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer gently for at least 30-40 minutes, or until vegetables are tender and the stew has thickened. Stir occasionally.

While the stew simmers, place the cubed potatoes and cauliflower florets in a large pot. Cover with cold water and add a pinch of salt. Bring to a boil and cook until very tender, about 15-20 minutes.
Drain the potatoes and cauliflower well. Return them to the pot or a large bowl.
Add the plant-based milk, olive oil (or vegan butter), nutritional yeast (if using), salt, and pepper. Mash until smooth and creamy using a potato masher or immersion blender.
Remove the bay leaf from the stew. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve the Vegan Bourguignon hot, spooned over generous servings of the potato cauliflower mash. Garnish with fresh parsley.

title: Vegetable Fritters
ingredients: 1 cup chopped spinach (or any leafy green)
1/2 cup all-purpose flour (you can use chickpea flour for a gluten-free option)
instructions: Start by grating the zucchini and carrots.
If using spinach, chop it finely.
Place the grated zucchini in a clean kitchen towel and squeeze out excess moisture.
In a large bowl, combine the grated zucchini, carrots, chopped spinach, flour, Parmesan cheese (if using), eggs, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper.
Mix everything until well combined.
In a large skillet, heat about 1/4 inch of oil over medium heat. You can test if the oil is hot enough by dropping a small amount of the batter into the oil; it should sizzle.
Drop spoonfuls of the vegetable mixture into the hot oil, flattening them slightly with the back of the spoon.
Fry for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Do not overcrowd the pan; you may need to work in batches.
Once cooked, transfer the fritters to a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Serve the fritters warm with a dipping sauce like yogurt, sour cream, or your favorite salsa.

title: Oven Baked Cabbage Burgers
ingredients: 1 head green cabbage, cut into 1-inch slices
1/2 cup shredded cheese (mozzarella, Monterey Jack), divided
instructions: Preheat oven to 400ºF (200ºC). Arrange cabbage slices on a baking sheet, brush with oil, and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 10 minutes until slightly tender.
In a bowl, combine ground beef with garlic, green onion, parsley, red chili flakes, half the cheese, salt, and pepper. Shape into four patties.
Top each cabbage slice with tomato sauce, cheese, a beef patty, and another sprinkle of cheese.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until the cheese melts and patties are cooked through. Serve hot.

title: One Pot Garlic Parmesan Chicken with Spinach
ingredients: 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast, cut into bite-size pieces
8 oz pasta (penne, rotini, or your favorite)
Crushed red pepper flakes (optional, for a little kick)
instructions: In a large skillet or pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chicken, season with salt & pepper, and cook until golden brown and cooked through. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, add garlic and cook for about 30 seconds until fragrant.
Pour in chicken broth and milk, bring to a simmer.
Add uncooked pasta and cook according to package directions, stirring occasionally.
Once pasta is tender, stir in parmesan cheese and spinach until creamy and spinach is wilted.
Return chicken to the pot and toss everything together.
Serve warm with extra parmesan on top!

title: Street Corn Chicken Casserole
ingredients: About 2 cups of shredded cooked chicken (fajita blend shredded chicken from Walmart recommended)
2-3 tsps each of chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and slap your mama seasoning
instructions: In a casserole dish add cream cheese, shredded cooked chicken, sour cream, corn, shredded fiesta blend cheese.
Season with chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, and slap your mama seasoning.
Mix well.
Top with grated Parmesan cheese around 1/2 a cup.
Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until a bit golden and bubbly.
Enjoy!!

title: Greek Stuffed Cabbage Rolls with Avgolemono Sauce
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Chicken stock (enough to just cover the rolls)
instructions: Carefully remove the core of the cabbage.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil and place the whole cabbage in, stem-side down. Boil for 10-15 minutes until the leaves soften slightly.
Remove the cabbage from the pot and carefully separate the leaves. Let them cool slightly.
In a large bowl, combine the ground beef, red onion, green onions, 2 tsp of salt, dill, mint, parsley, garlic, rice, olive oil, and black pepper. Mix well and knead until thoroughly combined.
Lay out the cabbage leaves on a work surface. Cut out the thick center rib from each leaf. If a leaf is too large, cut it in half.
Place about 1 tbsp of filling in the center of each leaf. Fold the sides over the filling and roll tightly into a log shape.
Pour the avgolemono sauce over the plated cabbage rolls.
Serve warm, garnished with extra fresh herbs if desired.

title: Million Dollar Chicken Casserole
ingredients: 3 cups cooked chicken, shredded or diced
1 can (10.5 oz) condensed cream of chicken soup
instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked chicken, condensed cream of chicken soup, sour cream, and mayonnaise. Mix until well blended.
Spread the mixture evenly into the prepared baking dish.
Sprinkle the shredded cheddar and mozzarella cheeses evenly over the top of the chicken mixture.
In a small bowl, combine the crushed Ritz crackers with the melted butter. Mix until the crackers are evenly coated.
Sprinkle the cracker mixture over the top of the cheese layer.
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the casserole is bubbly and the top is golden brown.
Remove from the oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with chopped parsley if desired.

title: Low Carb Pizza Bowl
ingredients: 1/2 pound ground beef or Italian sausage
Fresh basil or parsley for garnish
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the ground beef or sausage and cook until browned, breaking it into crumbles. Drain any excess grease.
Stir in garlic powder, onion powder, Italian seasoning, crushed red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper. Mix well and cook for another minute.
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In oven-safe bowls or ramekins, layer the cooked meat at the bottom. Pour the marinara sauce evenly over the meat.
Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the top, then add mushrooms, olives, bell peppers, and pepperoni slices. Top with grated Parmesan cheese.
Place the bowls in the oven and bake for 10-12 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.
Remove from the oven and garnish with fresh basil or parsley. Serve hot and enjoy your low-carb pizza bowl!

title: Roasted Cabbage with Lemon Garlic Butter
ingredients: Chopped fresh flat leaf parsley for garnish (optional)
instructions: Line a large rimmed baking sheet with foil; place in oven. Preheat the oven to 400°F. Remove any wilted or damaged leaves from cabbage. Cut the cabbage into 8 (1 1/4-inch) wedges, leaving the root end intact to help the wedges stay together.
Brush both sides of the cabbage wedges with oil and lemon juice; sprinkle with salt.
Remove the baking sheet from the oven; arrange the cabbage wedges on it in a single layer. Roast until tender and slightly browned, 40 to 45 minutes, flipping halfway through.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over medium heat, about 1 minute. Stir in lemon zest, garlic, garlic salt and lemon-pepper. Spoon or brush the mixture evenly over both sides of the roasted cabbage (about 1 1/2 teaspoons per side). Return the cabbage wedges to the oven; roast for 5 minutes more.
Sprinkle crushed red pepper evenly over the cabbage wedges. Garnish with parsley and serve with lemon wedges, if desired.

title: The Best Taco Rice
instructions: In a large skillet, cook and crumble ground beef until browned. Drain any grease.
Add taco seasoning and water to the skillet. Stir well and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat, then add uncooked Minute Rice. Stir to combine.
Cover the skillet and cook for 5 minutes, or until the rice is fully tender.
Remove the lid and mix in salsa and cheddar cheese until thoroughly blended.
Serve hot and enjoy!

title: Sweet Potatoes Filled with Roast Turkey and Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: Zest and juice of one large navel orange (with water added to make 1 cup total)
instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Scrub the sweet potatoes under cool water and pierce them all over with a fork. Wrap each potato in foil and place them on a small baking pan.

In a separate baking pan, place the turkey breast. Season it with sea salt, black pepper, garlic powder, onion powder, and dried basil. Pour lemon juice over the turkey and add chicken broth along with 1/2 cup of water to the pan. Place both pans in the oven side by side. Roast for about 1 hour or until the sweet potatoes are soft and the turkey reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C) on a meat thermometer.

While the potatoes and turkey are roasting, prepare the cranberry sauce. In a small saucepan, combine all ingredients except for 1/2 cup of cranberries. If using fresh cranberries, rinse and discard any wrinkled ones, then add the rest to the pan. If using frozen, add them directly. Stir and bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer for 5-8 minutes, or until most berries have popped. Stir in the remaining cranberries and let cool.

Once the sweet potatoes are done, cut each in half and allow them to cool slightly. Use a fork to fluff the potato flesh inside the skin, creating a well for the turkey. Add about 5 ounces of shredded turkey to each potato half and top with 3 tablespoons of cranberry sauce. Place the stuffed potatoes back in the oven for 5 minutes to heat through.
After heating, sprinkle each stuffed sweet potato with 1 tablespoon of chopped pecans. Serve warm and enjoy!
